people.name: Jeremy Lin
people.title: Basketball Player
people.blurb: Lin, 25, is a graduate of Harvard University and is a point guard for the NBA's Houston Rockets.

people.name: John Cho
people.title: Actor
people.blurb: Born in South Korea, Cho first became a household name in the cult film Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle.

people.name: Lisa Ling
people.title: Journalist
people.blurb: Born in North California, Ling is best known for her role as host of Our America with Lisa Ling on OWN

people.name: Steven Chu
people.title: Former U.S. Secretary of Energy
people.blurb: Chu is the first person appointed to the U.S. Cabinet after having won a Nobel Prize in Physics in 1997.

people.name: Gary Locke
people.title: Former Governor of Washington
people.blurb: The Yale graduate is the first Chinese-American to ever serve as governor in the continental United States.

people.name: Michael Chang
people.title: Tennis Player
people.blurb: Chang became the youngest make player to win a Grand Slam singles title when he won the French Open in 1989 at age 17.

people.name: Yo-Yo Ma
people.title: Cellist
people.blurb: Ma was only seven years old when he performed for two U.S. Presidents, Eisenhower and Kennedy.

people.name: MC HotDog
people.title: Rapper
people.blurb: While not exactly Chinese-American, HotDog is a Taiwanese rapper known for his use of explicit lyrics in his song.

people.name: Yao Ming
people.title: Basketball Player
people.blurb: Ming was the first international player to ever be drafted No. 1 overall in the NBA Draft.
